cl1: I often delay opening bills or checking my bank app because I don't want to deal with it.
cl2: I prefer to ignore my financial reality and hope things work out on their own.
cl3: I check my bank balance constantly, even when I know nothing has changed.
cl4: Spending money makes me feel physically nervous, even when I can afford it.
cl5: I worry excessively about running out of money, regardless of how much I have saved.
co1: I feel that my financial situation is entirely determined by bad luck or outside forces.
co2: There is no point in making a financial plan because unexpected things always happen.
co3: I have strict spending rules that I cannot bring myself to break, even for special occasions.
co4: If I deviate from my budget even slightly, I feel a strong need to punish myself or cut back immediately.
co5: I struggle to relax because I feel I must monitor every penny to be safe.
sw1: I often feel 'less than' or ashamed when I compare my possessions to those of my peers.
sw2: I hide my true financial struggles from others because I fear they will think I am a failure.
sw3: I secretly feel superior to people who earn less or save less than I do.
sw4: I believe my net worth is the primary measure of my success and intelligence.
sw5: I feel that having money makes someone a better or more important person.
bo1: I often lend money or pay for others just to keep the peace, even when I can't afford it.
bo2: I find it extremely difficult to say 'no' to financial requests from family or friends.
bo3: I keep my income and spending habits a complete secret from everyone, including close partners.
bo4: I dislike accepting gifts or help because I don't want to feel indebted to anyone.
bo5: I prefer transaction-based relationships where everything is split evenly so I don't get taken advantage of.
gr1: I rarely look for new ways to improve my finances because I prefer staying in my comfort zone.
gr2: I stick to the financial habits I learned years ago, even if there might be better options now.
gr3: I feel restless and dissatisfied even when I meet my goals because I know I could always optimize further.
gr4: I spend a significant portion of my free time constantly researching how to maximize returns.
gr5: I struggle to celebrate financial wins because I am already focused on the next target.
